moves: 1. d4 d5 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bg5 Be7 5. e3 O-O 6. Nf3 b6 7. Bd3 Bb7 8. cxd5 exd5
comment:
Although such a
reply was generally thought as the best one, Lasker thought more than half an
hour before playing it. Half an hour to evaluate the other two possibilities:
8... Bxd5 and 8...Nxd5.

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bg5 Be7 5. e3 O-O 6. Nf3 b6 7. Bd3 Bb7 8. cxd5 exd5 9. Ne5
comment: This move would not have been possible with the Knight in d7

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bg5 Be7 5. e3 O-O 6. Nf3 b6 7. Bd3 Bb7 8. cxd5 exd5 9. Ne5 c5
comment:
White's position is already clearly better. Black has pushed his pawn in order
to allow his Knight to go out to c6 and allow a further control of the center.
The position required, instead, a better control of the square h7.

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bg5 Be7 5. e3 O-O 6. Nf3 b6 7. Bd3 Bb7 8. cxd5 exd5 9. Ne5 c5 10. Rc1 Nc6 11. O-O Nxe5 12. dxe5 Ne8 13. Bf4 f5 14. Qc2
1. d4 d5 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bg5 Be7 5. e3 O-O 6. Nf3 b6 7. Bd3 Bb7 8. cxd5 exd5 9. Ne5 c5 10. Rc1 Nc6 11. O-O Nxe5 12. dxe5 Ne8 13. Bf4 f5 14. Qc2 g5
comment:
(?) No! Is is impossible! The Great Lasker, with what looks like a "razor
shot", thinks he can steal a piece. Schlechter will prove that it is possible
to "steal to the thieves"!

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bg5 Be7 5. e3 O-O 6. Nf3 b6 7. Bd3 Bb7 8. cxd5 exd5 9. Ne5 c5 10. Rc1 Nc6 11. O-O Nxe5 12. dxe5 Ne8 13. Bf4 f5 14. Qc2 g5 15. Bg3 f4 16. Bxh7+ Kh8 17. Qg6 Nf6 18. exf6 Rxf6 19. Qh5 Kg7 20. Qxg5+ Kxh7 21. Bxf4 Rg6
comment:
Now Black is two pawns down and his King, in the
fight, has lost all his clothes. The thief has been robbed!
